entry.title: Those lips smooth, yeah I can feel what you're saying, praying
entry.summary:
Author: Ana Luz (AnaLuz13)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,620Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: The one Clark Kent wants and interview and end up offering a healing potion to Bruce Wayne’s child. Bruce has no other reaction besides the normal one: be completely smitten by him and start to plan on how to get his hands on his pants. — He’s vegetarian.It is all he provides. Probably because it does not directly answer the question, Clark pries:— Soy milk, then?Bruce feels a bit angry with himself as he the tension on his shoulders melt a little and he just nods. Just his luck that the damned cute reporter knows what he meant by vegetarian and have not just assumed it referred to meat. Come on, he is trying to be angry. He can’t even do his Brucie Wayne spoiled brat slash playboy persona. And just his luck, it was all in front of the reporter who was trying to put him in the same sack as Lex Luthor. Also the one he kept on searching photos of that pretty smile (not really important at the moment, though).

entry.title: The sun burns but he's gorgeously tanned
entry.summary:
Author: milliondollarhouses

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,471Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Gotham has been shaken by yet another murderer. Batman will do anything to stop him. Though, not just for the safety of the people. Doing anything also meaning having to work with an annoying reporter and and even worse "Superman". The riddle surrounding the kills only seem to deepen, as does Bruce's lonliness. Can Clark save him? Is he the one to pull the vampire out of his cave? Or will he too be disgusted when he realises the billionaires true nature. If that doesn't work, maybe Batman can charm the Superman. God, he really is desperate.   Or, the Riddlers kills bring both Batman and Superman, and Clark and Bruce together.

entry.title: Sweet Like Saccharine
entry.summary:
Author: Ekkolocation

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,867Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 19

Summary: Bruce slowly opens the door to his bedroom, and a heaviness enters with him. The air curdling in thick waves of emotion, leaving it feeling dense enough to cut through. His expression is neutral (painstakingly so), but when he makes eye contact with Clark something breaks in him. His face falls and he can't hold his emotions down anymore. He can't hold anything back when it comes to Clark. Clark makes his way over to him, gently cupping his face in his hands. "Oh honey…" OR Bruce has had a very long day and Clark discovers Bruce is very pretty when he cries.

entry.title: Cats and Dogs
entry.summary:
Author: riversiders

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,347Chapters: 9/16Kudos: 184

Summary: It's not that he doesn't like Clark. He’s obsessed with Clark, actually, and not just because he somehow conned his way into dating him. As suspicious and crazy as it makes Bruce feel, he cannot deny that Clark cares. He’s constantly checking in on Bruce. They talk on the phone practically every day, and Superman has become a frequent and regular visitor at Wayne Manor. Dick adores him. Alfred does too. He keeps making hints about ‘letting Mr. Kent into the club in an official capacity’. Clark is wonderful. He is good—too good. He won't treat Bruce the way Bruce wants to be treated.

entry.title: Miss the Mark
entry.summary:
Author: elihinata

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,069Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 123

Summary: Clark Kent has never shaken the feeling that he doesn’t quite belong. He grew up learning to hide—his strength, his heritage, his very self—all to protect a secret that kept him at arm’s length from everyone around him. But nothing made him feel more alone than discovering the one thing his Kryptonian biology denied him: a soulmate. While every human carried a mark guiding them to someone meant just for them, Clark carried nothing. No promise. No destined other. The more time passes, the heavier that truth becomes, aching under his skin until it finally breaks him. One night, overwhelmed by longing and starved for a connection he fears he’ll never have, Clark gives in to a single reckless impulse. He kisses the one person he trusts most in this world—his best friend, Bruce Wayne.   Or, the universe has a lot in store for an emotionally constipated furry and a lonely alien.

entry.title: Displaced
entry.summary:
Author: ClarkKents_Biceps

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,136Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 164

Summary: - The story where a bit of time travelling mishaps happen and make life very complicated for Superbat - Chaos. Pure chaos. Downtown Gotham City had gone to hell. The place was an absolute mess — in fact, calling it a mess was an understatement. Gotham shimmered like it had gone mad: cars levitated inches too high; graffiti shifted when no one looked; even the shadows seemed to dance. Chaos grinned in every windowpane. And behind it lurked an interdimensional imp — a creature with obscene power, far too much for anyone’s good — spreading madness as a result of trying to fanboy over his favourite hero. Every spark of chaos was one of his well-meant ideas let loose. “Nightwing!” Tim barked at his comms eyes locked on Gotham — alive, wild, awake. It was wrong, The city wasn’t supposed to move like this. Oh man we are so fucked…

entry.title: Gotham, Krypton, and Couples Counseling
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,554Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: Saving the world is easy. Talking about their feelings? That’s where the real danger lies. After an explosive argument during a League meeting (and the tragic loss of a perfectly good table), Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent are forcibly enrolled in couples counseling by the two most terrifying forces on Earth: Lois Lane and Diana Prince. Dr. Helen Sharp has worked with metahuman trauma, alien catastrophes, and gods with complexes—but nothing prepared her for a Bat and a Boy Scout who would rather wrestle a kaiju than admit they care. Between weaponized metaphors, color-coded worksheets, and one extremely underused moon base, Bruce and Clark learn that emotional vulnerability might just be the greatest superpower of all. World’s Finest, meets therapy bill.

Author: merxurie

Summary: Bruce Wayne has to do it all. He has to, because he chose this path. No one forced him to be Batman, to be the CEO that Wayne Enterprises needs, to adopt Dick Grayson and love him more everyday.
